SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
Candidate
This class represents candidates in an IR election.
CPL
CPL Election that can read in data from an ballot file, execute the CPL election algorithm, and output the results, all while writing to an audit file
Election
This is an abstract class that represents what CPL and IR both have in common
IR
This is the IR Class that handles the reading of an input election file and conduction of the IR election The class conducts the IR algorithm to determine the winner of an IR election with provided information
Main
This is what a user uses to run our Voting System program It then hands off control to the RunElection instance
Node
This represents a single Node (a candidate) in a ballot tree We can use this to access the children (further rankings along the ballot)
Party
Represents a Party, and holds asssociated information such as seat they win, number of votes received, name and candidates.
RunElection
Class meant to handle information before running the actual elections.
Tree
This class represent the way we store the ballots for each candidate.
